Surround the code in the static initializer with a try/catch and print a stack trace:
 
static {
   try {
      // original code from static initializer
   } catch(Throwable t) {
      t.printStackTrace();
   }
}
 
Then look at your stack trace. My guess is that you MIGHT be using a class in the initializer that does not play well with the JUnit class loader. If so, you'll need to add it to the excluded.properties file in the junit.jar. (That's a bit of a leap from your reported problem to what might actually be happening).
 
Anyway, do the above and you should be able to track down the error.

this is happening. Can anyone shed some light on this problem?
